page.title: 02Keadby Bridge Area.
page.content: The River Trent enters our rectangle on the western edge of the top left hand corner of our block. There's a lot of mud in the River Trent. It's a chocolate brown colour and there are little whirl pools in it. It's a tidal river. Keadby Bridge stands out as a feature of this area. It carries road and rail traffic across the River Trent from the eastern part of the county (South Humberside). Years ago (about 30) it used to lift to allow river traffic to reach Gainsborough. It was always a severe bottle neck to road transport, especially as lorries grew larger and rail transport became less important. This problem was eased when the M180 was completed in 1982.
